column2: depression_study <- depression %>% group_by(Gender, Study.Satisfaction, Depression) %>% summarise(count=n())
`summarise()` has grouped output by 'Gender', 'Study.Satisfaction'. You can override using the `.groups` argument.
ggplot(depression_study, aes(x = Study.Satisfaction, y = count, fill = Gender)) +
title = "Study Satisfaction of Students and Whether or not they are Depressed",
